intro: Chamaerhodiola atuntsuensis, commonly known as the Altai sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Chamaerhodiola atuntsuensis is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, including extreme temperatures and poor soil nutrients.
